title: Convenient to transit, all of NYC
text:
Located in an odd part of town, mostly industrial, but next to major transit hub for easy access to all of NYC. Walking distance to subways, elevated trains, Astoria. Major construction going on in area so this hotel was built ahead of the new neighborhood curve. For now, it seems like an odd location but area is building up around it. They have valet parking available but I chose a local garage for less, several blocks away using Spothero. Found an excellent burger bar called The Baroness about three blocks away. May have to walk a little further for other options. You can be in midtown Manhattan in 15 or 20 minutes. Building is situated facing north and south so you cannot really get a view of Manhattan except maybe the top two floors on the south west corner. Views are interesting for urban landscapes, lots of train action. There are quite a lot of new hotels in the area, the Holiday Inn three block north looks like it is situated nicely for Manhattan views. We enjoyed our stay and made an affordable way to stay multiple days in NYC. Walked up to Astoria to the Museum of the Moving Image, which was excellent. Our room heater did not work the first night but the next day they switched us to another room. Breakfast was pretty typical, can get crowded and in winter lobby is cold. Fist time I have seen steamed broccoli as a breakfast staple.
